tool.name: tool_1
tool.displayname: Multiple Regression Analysis (Points and Predictor Grids)

param.name: REGRESSION
param.dialogReference:
Regression

Grid, output

regression model applied to predictor grids

param.name: REGRESCORR
param.dialogReference:
Regression with Residual Correction

Grid, output, optional

optional

regression model applied to predictor grids with interpolated residuals added

param.name: RESAMPLING
param.dialogReference:
Resampling

Choice

Available Choices:

[0] Nearest Neighbour

[1] Bilinear Interpolation

[2] Bicubic Spline Interpolation

[3] B-Spline Interpolation

Default: 3

param.name: METHOD
param.dialogReference:
Method

Choice

Available Choices:

[0] include all

[1] forward

[2] backward

[3] stepwise

Default: 3

param.name: P_VALUE
param.dialogReference:
Significance Level

Floating point

Minimum: 0.000000

Maximum: 100.000000

Default: 5.000000

Significance level (aka p-value) as threshold for automated predictor selection, given as percentage

param.name: CROSSVAL
param.dialogReference:
Cross Validation

Choice

Available Choices:

[0] none

[1] leave one out

[2] 2-fold

[3] k-fold

Default: 0

param.name: CROSSVAL_K
param.dialogReference:
Cross Validation Subsamples

Integer

Minimum: 2

Default: 10

number of subsamples for k-fold cross validation

param.name: RESIDUAL_COR
param.dialogReference:
Residual Interpolation

Choice

Available Choices:

[0] Multilevel B-Spline Interpolation

[1] Inverse Distance Weighted

Default: 0

tool.summary: Linear regression analysis of point attributes with multiple grids. Details of the regression/correlation analysis will be saved to a table. The regression function is used to create a new grid with regression based values. The multiple regression analysis uses a forward selection procedure.

dataIdInfo.idCredit: Conrad, O., Bechtel, B., Bock, M., Dietrich, H., Fischer, E., Gerlitz, L., Wehberg, J., Wichmann, V., and Boehner, J. (2015): System for Automated Geoscientific Analyses (SAGA) v. 2.1.4, Geosci. Model Dev., 8, 1991-2007, doi:10.5194/gmd-8-1991-2015. [SAGA - System for Automated Geoscientific Analyses - saga-gis.org]
